channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes which caused puncture when cycling, 17th October
item.description:
Down Hatherley Lane eastbound.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes and inadequately repaired surface., 17th October
item.description:
Harp hill downslope of Stanley Road. The surface, particularly heading down the hill, is downright dangerous - forcing cars to take dangerous avoiding action, driving in middle of the road on narrow, blind bends. Individual, poorly executed patching is not sufficient. This area of road is long overdue resurfacing and it is scandalous that many other less badly damaged, less busy, less dangerous roads continue to be resurfaced without any action here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged footpath/verge, 17th October
item.description:
On the corner of the entrance to Noverton Avenue there is an overgrown prickly bush on one side and worn verge where people are forced to walk to the side of the pavement to avoid being scratched by the bush. When there has been rain the muddy bit gets slippery so the bushy overgrowth needs cutting well back to enable safe walking on a solid pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7a, Noverton Avenue, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement is significantly raised and is therefore very dangerous for pedestrians, 17th October
item.description:
The raised pavement is outside 34 Bournside Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Bournside Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Traffic light sequence, 17th October
item.description:
Traffic entering Churchdown cannot turn right into Pirton Lane because the right turning lane has been removed. This is backing up and disrupting the A40 Hamburger roundabout. Itâ€™s chaos. It worked perfectly with the roundabout, but the current sequencing allows only one or two vehicles through the lights (because everyone is trying to turn right) each turn. You need to adjust the sequence to provide long periods of traffic from single entry points to the junction to resolve the issue. Or reinstate the very effective roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Portable toilet left after recent resurfacing work. Begining to smell. Health hazard, 17th October
item.description:
Marleyfield Way, Churchdown GL3 1JW.Top our cul-de-sac. Resurfacing was done on Monday. Portable loo still there on Friday and starting to smell, Please remove urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marleyfield Way, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Fly tipping in Gardners Lane near School and the Folley plus bushes need trimming back Shelter, 17th October
item.description:
Flytipping happened about two weeks ago The bushes overhand the road and need to be clipped back to improve visability especially on the corner by Midwinter allotment entrance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardners Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 17th October
item.description:
SL not working at the location, plus it is obscured by trees when working and emits very little light as a consequence.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken road surface, 17th October
item.description:
Recent repairs have failed to address and resolve the safety issues on this roundabout. The road surface is in a very poor state with broken tarmac and differing levels of the road surface. This is very dangerous for cyclists and creates trip hazards for those on foot. This roundabout requires urgent work to make it safe to use, really frustrating that when Fairview Rd was resufaced the opportunity to repair the roundabout wasn't taken. The very recent repairs failed to address the issues and are failing already. Do we need a serious or fatal accident before action is taken?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting in Langdon Road and part of Fairfield Parade, 17th October
item.description:
The street lighting has been out for 4 days. It may be just a coincidence that BT Openreach have just dug up the pavement in Langdon Road to unstall WiFi to 252 Bath Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
